tit.e: Third High School (under the prewar school educational system)
tit.cmt: http://www.kyoto-u.ac.jp/en/profile/intro/history/index.htm/ HIGHERThird Higher Schoolという訳もある。（出典："Schooldays in Imperial Japan" (p.65) written by Donald Roden)
tit.e: Third High School (under the prewar school educational system)
Third High School (under the prewar school educational system)

sen.j: 旧制第三高等学校（きゅうせいだいさんこうとうがっこう）は、現在の京都大学の前身の一つとなった旧制高等学校である。
sen.e: Under the prewar school educational system, Third High School was one of the high schools that later became a foundation of the present Kyoto University.
Under the prewar school educational system, Third Higher School was one of the high schools that later became a foundation of the present Kyoto University.
Under the prewar school educational system, Third High School was one of the high schools that later became a foundation of the present Kyoto University.

sen.j: 略称は「三高」。
sen.e: The school was commonly called "Sanko".
The school was commonly called "Sanko."
The school was commonly called "Sanko."

sen.j: 初代校長は折田彦市。
sen.e: The first president was Hikoichi ORITA
Hikoichi Orita was the first president.
Hikoichi ORITA was its first president.

sen.j: 1869年（明治2年）、大阪に舎密局（せいみきょく）設置。
sen.e: 1869: Seimi-kyoku was founded in Osaka
1869: Seimi-kyoku was founded in Osaka
1869: Seimi-kyoku was founded in Osaka

sen.j: 名称変更ラッシュ。
sen.e: The school underwent continual changes in structure and nomenclature.
The school underwent continuous changes in structure and nomenclature.
The school underwent continuous changes in structure and nomenclature.

sen.j: 1870年（明治3年）、化学所→理学所→開成所→
sen.e: 1870: Institute of Chemistry (Kagakusho)→Institute of Science (Rigakusho)→Kaiseijo→
sen.cmt: 「→」の記号はそのまま翻訳の中でも使用しました。科学所、理学所、開成所の定訳不明
sen.e: 1870: Institute of Chemistry (Kagakusho)→Institute of Science (Rigakusho)→Kaiseijo→
1870: Institute of Chemistry (Kagakusho)→Institute of Science (Rigakusho)→Kaiseijo→

sen.j: 1872年（明治5年）、第四大学区第一番中学※→
sen.e: 1872: Fourth University District No. 1 Junior High School*→
1872: Fourth University District No. 1 Junior High School*→
1872: Fourth University District No. 1 Junior High School*→

sen.j: 1873年（明治6年）、第三大学区第一番中学→開明学校→
sen.e: 1873: Third University District No.1 Junior High School→Kaimei Gakko→
1873: Third University District No. 1 Junior High School→Kaimei Gakko→
1873: Third University District No. 1 Junior High School→Kaimei Gakko→

sen.j: 1874年（明治7年）、大阪外国語学校→大阪英語学校。
sen.e: 1874: Osaka School of Foreign Languages→Osaka English Academy
sen.cmt: 大阪外国語学校の定訳不明大阪英語学校→Osaka English Academy (出典"Schooldays in Imperial Japan" (p.33) written by Donald Roden)※専門学校令による大阪外国語学校（後出）との直接の継承関係はない。
sen.e: 1874: Osaka School of Foreign Languages→Osaka English Academy
1874: Osaka School of Foreign Languages→Osaka English Academy

sen.j: さらに1879年（明治12年）、大阪専門学校。
sen.e: 1879: Osaka Technical College
1879: Osaka Technical College
1879: Osaka Technical College

sen.j: 1880年（明治13年）大阪中学校。
sen.e: 1880: Osaka Middle School
1880: Osaka Middle School
1880: Osaka Middle School

sen.j: 1885年（明治18年）、大学分校を経て、1886年（明治19年）第三高等中学校設置。
sen.e: 1885: Reorganized as a branch school of a university, and then the Third Higher Middle School (Dai San Koto Chugakko) was established in 1886.
1885: It was reorganized as a branch school of a university, after which the Third Higher Middle School (Dai San Koto Chugakko) was established in 1886.
1885: It was reorganized as a branch school of a university, after which the Third Higher Middle School (Dai San Koto Chugakko) was established in 1886.

sen.j: 1887年（明治20年）、岡山県立医学校を第三高等中学校医学部（岡山市栄町）とした。
sen.e: 1887: Okayama Prefectural Medical School became the Third Higher Middle School Medical Faculty (Sakae-machi, Okayama City).
sen.cmt: 岡山県立医学校→Okayama Prefectural Medical School (http://www.okayama-u.ac.jp/user/ad/gaiyou/pdf/08_09.pdf)第三高等中学校医学部→The Third Higher Middle School Medical Faculty （出典同じ）栄町の読みは「サカエマチ」と思われます。（参考URL: http://yuujirou.twinspark.co.jp/zips/search?pref=33&key=%E6%A0%84%E7%94%BA&output=1&ooguchi=no）
sen.e: 1887: Okayama Prefectural Medical School became the Third Higher Middle School Medical Faculty (Sakae-machi, Okayama City).
1887: Okayama Prefectural Medical School became the Third Higher Middle School Medical Faculty (Sakae-machi, Okayama City).

sen.j: 本科（大学進学への予備教育）発足。
sen.e: Main course (university preparatory education) started.
The main curriculum (university preparatory education) started.
The main curriculum (university preparatory education) started.

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）、第三高等中学校を大阪市東区 (大阪市)（現中央区 (大阪市)）から京都市上京区（現左京区）に移転。
sen.e: 1889: Third Higher Middle School was relocated from Higashi-ku (present Chuo-ku), Oasaka City to Kamigyo-ku (present Sakyo-ku), Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 「大阪市東区 (大阪市)（現中央区 (大阪市)）」という箇所は「大阪市東区（現中央区）」と読み替えて訳しました。
sen.e: 1889: Third Higher Middle School was relocated from Higashi-ku (present-day Chuo-ku), Oasaka City to Kamigyo-ku (present-day Sakyo-ku), Kyoto City.
1889: Third Higher Middle School was relocated from Higashi-ku (present-day Chuo-ku), Osaka City to Kamigyo-ku (present-day Sakyo-ku), Kyoto City.

sen.j: 既存の医学部に加えて法学部の設置。
sen.e: College of Law was also founded in addition to the established College of Medicine.
The College of Law was also founded in addition to the already established College of Medicine.
The College of Law was also founded in addition to the already established College of Medicine.

sen.j: 1893年（明治27年）、第三高等中学校を第三高等学校に昇格。
sen.e: 1893: Third Higher Middle School was elevated to the Third High School
1893: The Third Higher Middle School was elevated to status as the Third High School.
1893: The Third Higher Middle School was elevated to status as the Third High School.

sen.j: 本科（大学進学への予備教育）、予科の廃止。
sen.e: Main course (university preparatory education) and preparatory course were abolished.
The main curriculum (university preparatory education) and preparatory course were abolished.
The main curriculum (university preparatory education) and preparatory course were abolished.

sen.j: 工学部の設置。
sen.e: College of Engineering was established.
The College of Engineering was established.
The College of Engineering was established.

sen.j: 京都帝国大学の設立（1897年）に先立ち、大学予科の設置（大学進学への予備教育の復活）。
sen.e: Preparatory course was reestablished for the Kyoto Imperial University, which was to be founded in 1897. (University preparatory education was restored.)
A preparatory course was re-established for the Kyoto Imperial University, which was to be founded in 1897 (thus restoring university preparatory education).
A preparatory course was re-established for the Kyoto Imperial University, which was to be founded in 1897 (thus restoring university preparatory education).

sen.j: 法学部と工学部の廃止（1901年正式に発令）。
sen.e: Colleges of Law and Engineering closed. (The ordinance was issued in 1901)
The colleges of Law and Engineering closed. (The ordinance was issued in 1901.)
The colleges of Law and Engineering closed. (The ordinance was issued in 1901.)

sen.j: 医学部は岡山大学へ（1901年）。
sen.e: 1901: College of Medicine was transformed into Okayama University.
1901: College of Medicine was transformed into Okayama University.
1901: College of Medicine was transformed into Okayama University.

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）、旧制京都大学（昭和22年まで京都帝国大学）、京都大学附属医学専門部とともに新制京都大学に包括され、一般教養を担当する分校へ。
sen.e: 1949: Along with the former Kyoto University (called Kyoto Imperial University until 1947) and Medical Specialization Division of Kyoto University, Third High School came to be included in the present Kyoto University as its branch school (Bunko) and provided education in the liberal arts.
sen.cmt: 京都大学付属医学専門部→定訳不明
sen.e: 1949: Along with the former Kyoto University (called Kyoto Imperial University until 1947) and the Medical Specialization Division of Kyoto University, Third High School came to be included in the present Kyoto University as its branch school (bunko) and provided education in the liberal arts.

1949: Along with the former Kyoto University (called Kyoto Imperial University until 1947) and the Medical Specialization Division of Kyoto University, Third High School came to be included in the present Kyoto University as its branch school (bunko) and provided education in the liberal arts.

sen.j: 1950年（昭和25年）、第三高等学校としての最後の卒業生を送り出し、正式に廃止される。
sen.e: 1950: Third High School was abolished after the final graduates were sent out.
1950: The Third High School was abolished once the last of its students had graduated.
1950: The Third High School was abolished once the last of its students had graduated.

sen.j: 1954年（昭和29年）、分校は教養部に改称。
sen.e: 1954: The branch school was renamed the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences.
1954: The branch school was renamed the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences.
1954: The branch school was renamed the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences.

sen.j: 1991年（平成3年）、教養部改革の流れで独立大学院人間・環境学研究科設置。
sen.e: 1991: In the course of reforming the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences, the Graduate School of Human and Environmental Studies was established.
1991: In the course of reforming the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences, the Graduate School of Human and Environmental Studies was established.
1991: In the course of reforming the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences, the Graduate School of Human and Environmental Studies was established.

sen.j: 1992年（平成4年）、教養部を改組し総合人間学部設置。
sen.e: 1992: The College of Liberal Arts and Sciences was reorganized as the Faculty of Integrated Human Studies.
1992: The College of Liberal Arts and Sciences was reorganized as the Faculty of Integrated Human Studies.
1992: The College of Liberal Arts and Sciences was reorganized as the Faculty of Integrated Human Studies.

sen.j: 教養部は廃止。
sen.e: The College of Liberal Arts and Sciences was abolished.
The College of Liberal Arts and Sciences was abolished.
The College of Liberal Arts and Sciences was abolished.

sen.j: 2003年（平成15年）、総合人間学部と人間・環境学研究科が統合。
sen.e: 2003: Faculties of Integrated Human Studies and Human and Environmental Studies were merged.
2003: The faculties of Integrated Human Studies and Human and Environmental Studies were merged.
2003: The faculties of Integrated Human Studies and Human and Environmental Studies were merged.

sen.j: ※ 学制を参照
sen.e: * See Education System Order

* See Education System Order
